bingo. it does not, but 2.4's does
but it's not a symlink to /usr/share/pycentral/python-cairo/site-packages/cairo/__init__.py and not listed in dpkg -L

hmm, it should automatically get created when you install python-cairo.  I have it here, so it might be worth a try to just ask it to purge and then reinstall: 'sudo aptitude purge python-cairo && sudo aptitude install python-cairo'
purge is too large a chain of dependencies that will go out and in.
see if 'sudo aptitude reinstall python-cairo' is enough
yes, now it's in neither dir and neither version of python can load it
and you're not using any non-ubuntu repos?
